PARIS (AP) - A French gay soccer team says its members were victims of homophobia when a team of Muslim players refused to play a match against them.
 The Paris Foot Gay team says Tuesday it received an e-mail from the Creteil Bebel club canceling a match scheduled for last Sunday.
 "Because of the principles of our team, which is a team of devout Muslims, we can't play against you," the e-mail said, according to Paris Foot Gay. The e-mail received Saturday said, "Our convictions are much more important than a simple football match."
 Paris Foot Gay said in a statement that it asked the amateur league to sanction Creteil Bebel.
 Zahir Belgarbi, identified as a spokesman for Creteil Bebel, told France-Info radio he apologized if "anyone felt upset or hurt." French gay soccer team snubbed by Muslim team

 If a team came up and said "we're a BLACK team", or a "WHITE team" would it not raise some serious eyebrows?

 Washington Post sports columnist Sally Jenkins, in her piece Their Words of Discouragement, says, "Judging by some of the witless remarks in the sports world over the past few days, athletes and coaches are having a nationwide contest for XXXXX of the Week. The question becomes, should we ask these people about anything important, ever? Should we once and for all restrict the questions we put to sports figures to such matters as, what should the Red Sox do in the offseason, and, what are the merits of a 3-4 scheme versus the 4-3?"AfterElton.com - Homophobia in Sports: Is the Media Part of the Problem?

 Something is changing people's attitudes.

 I can see how it could be taken that way, but IMO, there's a difference between homophobia and exercising one's preference. Homophobia is an irrational fear, exercising one's preference isn't. 
 For example, I have no desire to see a WNBA game. It isn't because I fear women, I just don't see the caliber of play being up to that of the NBA and therefore, spend my entertainment dollars elsewhere.
 
 IMO, marketing themselves as an "all gay soccer team" isn't going to get me rushing to the box office.
foundit66

I can see how it could be taken that way, but IMO, there's a difference between homophobia and exercising one's preference. Homophobia is an irrational fear, exercising one's preference isn't. 

 Ahhh.
 Once again, I must educate right-wingers.
 "-phobia" does not mean JUST "irrational fear".
 
 homophobia: 
 ** irrational fear of, aversion to, or discrimination against homosexuality or homosexuals
 xenophobia:
 ** fear and hatred of strangers or foreigners or of anything that is strange or foreign
 
 -phobia
 * 1 : exaggerated fear of <acrophobia<
 * 2 : intolerance or aversion for <photophobia<
 
 So you see, if somebody cannot watch a perfectly good player because he is gay, that IS homophobia. We should obviously recognize the situation as "racist" if the situation revolved around race, but for some reason you want to ignore the prejudice and proclaim it simply "exercising one's preference" while you ignore the prejudice that fuels that prejudice...
 
 
 
For example, I have no desire to see a WNBA game. It isn't because I fear women, I just don't see the caliber of play being up to that of the NBA and therefore, spend my entertainment dollars elsewhere.

 And likewise, if a player is an inferior player, obviously the issue would be the quality of the game regardless of the sexual orientation.
 But what we're talking about here is making the decision on SEXUAL ORIENTATION.
 NOT on the quality of play...
 
 As is customary, I have to explain a LOT when it comes to this issue cause for some reason some posters insist on muddling what is crystal clear.
 
 
 
IMO, marketing themselves as an "all gay soccer team" isn't going to get me rushing to the box office.

 And what does "gay" mean about their capability to play the game?
 That's right. You don't know squat about their quality.
 
 You've made a judgment based solely on sexual orientation. Demonstrating your aversion to homosexuals.
 Ergo, homophobia...
 
 So yes. You can exercise your prejudiced preference.
 But don't try to pretend it's not about prejudice... emoticon_ic
